Key Arguments: The Bill should not place regulatory powers solely in the hands of the ACMA, as it breaches freedom of speech and privacy.
The Bill violates Australia's commitment to human rights under Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The Bill lacks a holistic approach to managing misinformation and disinformation on digital platforms.
The Bill requires further consultation and review before being considered for legislation.
Notable Quotes: This is a breach of freedom of speech and privacy.

The greatest danger to this Bill is that it lacks sufficient safeguards and is a provision for organisations and interest-groups including the Government to control and manage the perception of the General Public on issues through censorship.
